sentences.sContent: So the next time you see a chunk of seaweed ... notice the beauty of it, yes.
sentences.sContent_eng: So the next time you see a chunk of seaweed ... notice the beauty of it, yes.
sentences.sCn: 所以下次你碰见一大片海藻时，要毫不犹豫的欣赏它的美。

sentences.sContent: The crabs come closer to shore at this time of year, Child said, where they feed on the seaweed.
sentences.sContent_eng: The crabs come closer to shore at this time of year, Child said, where they feed on the seaweed.
sentences.sCn: 这些螃蟹每年这个时间，要来到这里海岸的边上，恰尔特说，它们以吃海藻为生。

sentences.sContent: Land that was once at the bottom of the sea now lies around the town in wide, fertile fields; where crabs once crawled, donkeys pick their way; in place of seaweed, roses grow.
sentences.sContent_eng: Land that was once at the bottom of the sea now lies around the town in wide, fertile fields; where crabs once crawled, donkeys pick their way; in place of seaweed, roses grow.
sentences.sCn: 曾经是海底的陆地现在成了广阔肥沃的田野，在城市的四周伸展开来，这里曾经有过螃蟹爬行，现在则有驴子择路而行，生长出了海藻和玫瑰花。

remMethod.val: sea(海水)+weed(杂草)→海水里像草一样的东西→海草， 海藻

trans.tranOther: a plant that grows in the sea
